column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=[0142] Then a method using an optical pulse wave sensor, easily attachable to a finger or temple, in place of electrocardiograph, has been proposed.
#Text=A pulse wave is a pressure fluctuation in an artery which occurs in accordance with a heartbeat and which is transmitted to a peripheral artery as a wave.
#Text=The optical pulse wave sensor measures an undulating volume change of blood in the peripheral artery by utilizing light absorption characteristic of hemoglobin in the blood.
#Text=[0143] Upon use of the pulse wave sensor, as shown in FIG. 30, a pulse rate N is calculated from a pulse wave peak appearance interval W.

#Text=However, when body motion occurs in a portion where the pulse wave sensor is attached, a peak synchronized with the body motion appears in the detected pulse wave independently of the pulse rate (heartbeat) due to turbulence of blood stream in the peripheral artery.
#Text=As a result, the pulse rate calculated by using the pulse wave sensor does not correspond with the actual pulse rate.

#Text=Further, the peak based on the body motion (body motion component) may appear in a frequency area overlapping with a peak based on the pulse, and cannot be easily eliminated with a filter or the like.
#Text=[0144] To solve this problem, an apparatus, having a body motion sensor (acceleration sensor) in addition to a pulse wave sensor is known (e.g., see JP2816944 B2 (U.S.
#Text=Pat.

#Text=When the body motion sensor has detected body motion, the apparatus eliminates a body motion component specified from a detection signal from the body motion sensor and extracts a pulse component based on the result of frequency analysis (spectra) of a detection signal obtained by the pulse wave sensor.
#Text=Here, however, although a compact optical pulse wave sensor is used for not limiting the test subject's actions, a separate body motion sensor is required.
#Text=This entails a problem of increase in the number of apparatus components.
#Text=[0145] Further, an apparatus using an optical pulse wave sensor to emit two types of lights having different wavelengths is known (e.g., see JP-H7-88092 A (U.S.
#Text=Pat.

#Text=The apparatus discriminates a pulse component from a body motion component and detects exercise intensity of the living body or the like, from a ratio and the change of rate between amplitudes of peak frequency components included in the respective detection signals.
#Text=The detection signals are detected using the lights having different wavelengths.

#Text=Here, two facts are utilized, i.e, the first fact that the light absorption characteristic of blood component changes in correspondence with light wavelength, and the second fact that the motion of living body influences blood flow rate.
#Text=[0146] Here, the separate body motion sensor is unnecessary, so that the size of the apparatus can be compact.

#Text=However, note that a relationship between a body motion component and a pulse component is affected by various factors, i.e., an attachment state of the sensor, individual differences (e.g., in heart beat strength or in subcutaneous fat thickness) of the test subject.
#Text=Further, note that the apparatus does not consider reflected light from the skin of the test subject that is significantly affected by the body motion.
#Text=Therefore, the calculation processing adopted in the apparatus cannot obtain the pulse and exercise data with high accuracy.

#Text=In particular, when the pulse sensor is attached to an arm or leg for aiming at convenience, a detection sensitivity for the pulse wave is decreased because of the subcutaneous fat compared with a case where the sensor is attached to a peripheral member such as a finger.
#Text=The pulse component is thereby hidden by the body motion component.
